title: Drake Maye talks silencing critics, Mike Vrabel’s sideline sprint, and more on WEEI

bullets: Patriots "It literally took everybody yesterday.
Special teams, offense, defense, coaching.
So it was cool to come out with a win.

title: Maine assistant principal dies after fiery crash during alleged police chase
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News “This news is incredibly difficult for us to process as a staff, and may be very difficult for your child as well," the school superintendent told families.

By Molly Farrar September 15, 2025 | 5:55 PM 2 minutes to read Classes were canceled at a Maine high school after a 34-year-old educator died in a fiery crash while allegedly speeding away from police Saturday night, officials said.
Jacob Brown, of Scarborough, was an assistant principal at Scarborough High School, a suburb just south of Portland, the district confirmed.

title: More than 3,400 voted: These finalists rose to the top for state flag, seal, and motto
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Readers Say More than 3,400 readers responded to our poll — and they didn't hold back.
The three highest-scoring options for the new Massachusetts state seal released last month by the Seal, Flag, and Motto Advisory Commission.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Mike Vrabel is ‘happy’ for Parker Romo’s perfect start, not ready to discuss moving on from Borregales
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots Romo, who lost the Patriots' kicking competition to Borregales, went 5-for-5 in his debut with Atlanta.

Mike Vrabel AP Photo/Doug Murray FOXBOROUGH — The Patriots stuck with Andy Borregales despite a pair of missed field-goals in the preseason, keeping the sixth-round pick over Parker Romo who did not have a preseason miss and booted a 57-yarder.
Borregales’s performance was a mixed bag on Sunday.

title: ‘Silenced by fear’: In wake of Charlie Kirk’s killing, BU conservatives say they’ve been marginalized
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News Student leaders call for greater protections for free speech and open dialogue on campus.
Boston University campus.

Blake Nissen/The Boston Globe Boston University College Republicans are urging the university to take a stronger stand for free speech, saying conservative students have “long been marginalized, silenced by fear of social intimidation, academic penalty, or hostility.

title: A Boston crypt tour now features a stolen ‘Cursed Brick,’ mailed back after ‘a string of bad luck’
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel Guided After-Hours Crypt Tours at Old North Church begin Sept.
The Cursed Brick, part of the After-Hours Crypt Tours at Old North Church.

title: Man pleads not guilty to shooting Boston police officer during Roxbury chase
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Shot multiple times during Friday’s chaotic incident, Daiquan Rice was ordered held without bail pending a dangerousness hearing.

David L Ryan/The Boston Globe By Abby Patkin September 15, 2025 | 4:02 PM 1 minute to read A man accused of shooting a Boston police officer during an early-morning foot chase in Roxbury last week was ordered held without bail following his arraignment Monday.

Shot multiple times during Friday’s chaotic incident, 31-year-old Daiquan Rice pleaded not guilty to a slew of charges that included attempted murder, possession of a Class B drug, and numerous firearms offenses.

title: ‘Super Troopers’ stars take a break from filming sequel to visit Fenway Park
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Entertainment Stars of the upcoming "Super Troopers 3" movie watched the Red Sox beat the Yankee at Fenway Park on Sunday.
"Super Troopers 3" actors Steve Lemme, Kevin Heffernan, Nat Faxon, Paul Soter, and Jay Chandrasekhar took a break from filming to watch the Red Sox at Fenway Park on Sunday, Sept.

title: Publications and Presentations on a Resume
author: Pattie Hunt Sinacole
bullets: Job Doc Pattie Hunt Sinacole provides advice Q: As a health care analyst, I have been fortunate enough to be asked to contribute to several articles.
I also have presented at a well-attended conference.
I have been asked to be “quoted” based on my areas of expertise.

title: Perfect ‘Sense’: Jerry Harrison of Talking Heads brings the band’s classic concert film to Beverly Sunday
author: Blake Maddux
bullets: Music "I think that there are a number of reasons why it has stood the test of time," says Harrison, who will host the screening.
Jerry Harrison — here with Chris Frantz in a scene from “Stop Making Sense” — will be in Beverly to screen and discuss the film this weekend.
Jordan Cronenweth/A24 By Blake Maddux September 15, 2025 | 2:10 PM 6 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
